title: HAIgermany
text: Healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) infections patients acquire receiving medical treatment hospital healthcare facility. HAIgermany package provides datasets tools explore visualize HAIs observed ECDC Point Prevalence Survey (2011–2012). vignette demonstrates : Load inspect included datasets Understand variable represents Launch Shiny app interactive exploration

title: HAIgermany
text: load package:

title: HAIgermany
text: package includes two key datasets derived ECDC PPS data: num_hai_patients_tidy Counts patients actually healthcare-associated infection (HAI), broken age group infection type. mccabe_scores_distr_tidy Counts patients risk infection type, age group. example: Surgical site infections (SSI) relevant patients underwent surgery Urinary tract infections (UTI) relevant patients urinary catheter Let’s explore :
code: head(num_hai_patients_tidy) #>   AgeGroup TotalCases Infection #> 1    [0;0]          0       HAP #> 2  [10;14]          0       HAP #> 3  [15;19]          0       HAP #> 4    [1;4]          0       HAP #> 5  [20;24]          0       HAP #> 6  [25;29]          1       HAP head(mccabe_scores_distr_tidy) #>   AgeGroup PatientsAtRisk Infection #> 1    [0;0]             39       BSI #> 2    [0;0]             62       HAP #> 3    [0;0]             28       UTI #> 4    [0;0]             14       SSI #> 5    [0;0]              2       CDI #> 6    [1;4]             17       BSI

title: HAIgermany
text: num_hai_patients_tidy AgeGroup Age range patients Infection Type HAI (e.g. SSI, UTI, BSI, etc.) TotalCases Number patients HAI age group mccabe_scores_distr_tidy AgeGroup Age range patients Infection Type HAI patients risk developing PatientsAtRisk Total number patients risk HAI age group

title: HAIgermany
text: ’ll notice mccabe_scores_distr_tidy generally much higher counts - includes patients risk, just became infected.
code: summary(num_hai_patients_tidy$TotalCases) #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>   0.000   0.000   1.000   4.358   6.000  33.000 summary(mccabe_scores_distr_tidy$PatientsAtRisk) #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>    0.00   13.00   36.00   93.45  112.50  513.00

title: HAIgermany
text: can use ggplot2 explore age trends:
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(num_hai_patients_tidy, aes(x = AgeGroup, y = TotalCases, fill = Infection)) + geom_col(position = "dodge") + labs( title = "Number of HAI Patients by Age Group", x = "Age Group", y = "Number of Patients" ) +   theme_minimal() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: HAIgermany
text: HAIgermany Shiny app allows interactive exploration infection patterns. Within app, can: Filter HAIs type Compare infection rates across age groups Explore distributions interactively

title: HAIgermany
text: HAIgermany package provides: Clean, tidy data HAIs Germany interactive app exploring infection patterns

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nathalie Aaes-Jørgensen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aaes-Jørgensen N (2025). HAIgermany: Shiny App Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data Germany. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://etc5523-2025.github.io/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-NathalieAaes.
code: @Manual{,   title = {HAIgermany: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany},   author = {Nathalie Aaes-Jørgensen},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://etc5523-2025.github.io/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-NathalieAaes}, }

what: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany
title: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany
text: Welcome HAIgermany R package - toolkit exploring visualizing healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) Germany. package provides tidy datasets interactive Shiny application based data BHAI-package turn based ECDC Point Prevalence Survey (2011–2012).

title: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany
text: install package directly GitHub:
code: # Install the remotes package if needed install.packages("remotes")  # Then install HAIgermany remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-NathalieAaes/HAIgermany")

title: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany
text: num_hai_patients_tidy: Number patients actually healthcare-associated infection (HAI), broken age group infection type. mccabe_scores_distr_tidy: Counts include patients PPS survey risk specific infection, just became infected. example, patients risk surgical site infections (SSI) underwent surgery, patients risk urinary tract infections (UTI) urinary catheter. dataset tidy ready analysis visualization.

title: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany
text: Launch interactive HAI Explorer app: Use app filter infections, explore age distributions, visualize McCabe score patterns interactively.

title: Shiny App for Exploring Healthcare-Associated Infection Data in Germany
text: Explore documentation examples navigation bar : Documentations: function dataset reference Vignettes: step--step usage examples analyses (e.g., HAIgermany vignette)

what: McCabe Score Distribution by Age Group and Infection Type — mccabe_scores_distr_tidy
title: McCabe Score Distribution by Age Group and Infection Type — mccabe_scores_distr_tidy
text: tidy dataset summarizing distribution McCabe scores across different age groups types healthcare-associated infections (HAIs). row represents unique combination age group infection type, total number patients risk infection age group.

title: McCabe Score Distribution by Age Group and Infection Type — mccabe_scores_distr_tidy
McCabe Score Distribution by Age Group and Infection Type — mccabe_scores_distr_tidy
text: tibble columns: AgeGroup Age group patients (e.g., "20-24", "25-29") Infection Type healthcare-associated infection (e.g., "UTI", "SSI") PatientsAtRisk Number patients risk infection age group

title: McCabe Score Distribution by Age Group and Infection Type — mccabe_scores_distr_tidy
text: BHAI dataset (ECDC Point Prevalence Survey 2011–2012)

title: McCabe Score Distribution by Age Group and Infection Type — mccabe_scores_distr_tidy
text: Note counts represent patients risk, actually developed infection. example, patients risk surgical site infections (SSI) underwent surgery, patients risk urinary tract infections (UTI) urinary catheter.

what: Number of HAI Patients by Age Group — num_hai_patients_tidy
title: Number of HAI Patients by Age Group — num_hai_patients_tidy
text: tidy dataset containing total number patients per age group type healthcare-associated infection (HAI). row represents unique combination age group infection type, corresponding total number patients.

title: Number of HAI Patients by Age Group — num_hai_patients_tidy
Number of HAI Patients by Age Group — num_hai_patients_tidy
text: tibble columns: AgeGroup Age group patients (e.g., "20-24", "25-29") Infection Type healthcare-associated infection (e.g., "UTI", "SSI") TotalCases Total number patients age group infection type

title: Number of HAI Patients by Age Group — num_hai_patients_tidy
text: BHAI dataset

what: Launch the HAIgermany Shiny App — run_HAIgermany_app
title: Launch the HAIgermany Shiny App — run_HAIgermany_app
text: function launches interactive Shiny application included HAIgermany package. app allows users explore healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) Germany, filter infection type age group, visualize McCabe score distributions interactively.

title: Launch the HAIgermany Shiny App — run_HAIgermany_app
Launch the HAIgermany Shiny App — run_HAIgermany_app
text: Runs Shiny app new window.

title: Launch the HAIgermany Shiny App — run_HAIgermany_app
text: app requires interactive R session (e.g., RStudio R GUI). automatically opens browser RStudio Viewer pane. app directory found, error thrown suggesting reinstallation.

title: Launch the HAIgermany Shiny App — run_HAIgermany_app
